sn47.27:1.3: “Reverend, they speak of the one called ‘an adept’.
sn47.27:1.5: “Reverends, an adept is someone who has completely developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.27:2.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.
sn47.27:2.3: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.27:2.5: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of covetousness and displeasure for the world.
sn47.27:2.6: An adept is someone who has completely developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
